physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Serum LEP concentrations increased (162 ng/mL), indicating potential LEPR deficiency; GH secretion in response to stimulation was low (ornithine test, 6.2 ng/mL); normal human chorionic gonadotropin hormone stimulation tests.
Resting metabolic rate measured at 18 years was 26% lower than predicted by Harris-Benedict equation (measured REE: 2580 kcal; predicted: 3080 kcal).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: The resting metabolic rate normalized to predicted values by age 19.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Bone age evaluated at 19 years was 17 years. Free testosterone concentration normalized, and secondary sexual characteristics developed.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Overall improvement in hormonal status; sexual characteristics appeared after years of deficiency.
